intro: Phytocrene interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted phytocrene, is a rare flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
